meanings.definition: The outline or shape of a roof.
meanings.sent1: The roofline of the house was straight and simple.
meanings.sent2: I could see the roofline of the building from far away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the roofline, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the roofline of the barn cast a long shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The jagged roofline of the castle made it look like a crown atop the hill.

meanings.definition: The highest point of a roof.
meanings.sent1: The roofline of the cabin reached up to touch the sky.
meanings.sent2: Birds often perch on the roofline of our house.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed to the roofline and meowed loudly, demanding to be let in.
meanings.sent4: The roofline of the church towered above the other buildings in the town.
meanings.sent5: The roofline of the skyscraper disappeared into the clouds on a foggy day.

meanings.sent1: Leaves gathered along the roofline after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The snow slid off the roofline with a loud thud.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel peeked over the roofline, curious about the world below.
meanings.sent4: Rainwater dripped steadily from the roofline, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled through the gaps in the roofline, making an eerie sound.
